p.s: In the given speech, held by Sir David Attenborough on the occasion of the opening of the COP26, he strongly advocates for the present world leaders to take measures in order to reduce the global CO2 emissions.
He starts off by saying that decreasing this number should be the key aspect in the conference.
Then, he goes on by arguing how climate change is of anthropogenic cause, meaning that, e.g. due to the burning of fossil fuels, humans created the catastrophe for themselves.
Furthermore, the effects will be noticeable for everybody, although, today, the least guilty of causing global warming are the ones most affected.
Sir Attenborough continues by tressing how, for the sake of younger generations, change should and could be made, as it is known how to decrease emissions and restore nature.
He also pronounces that there is still a way to go in order to save the planet and that this has to happen together with all nations motivated by hope, not fear.
He finally says that emissions can be decreased by commitments made in Glasgow and stresses how it is the deligates task to so and go beyond empty words and promises.
